title.narrative: Scaling Up Emergency Health Response for IPC 5 Populations in Akobo and Pibor

description.narrative:
To address the emergency health needs of the affected population, WHO are increasing access to basic life savings health services targeting 72,868 men, women, boys and girls with three emergency partners, thereby ensuring uninterrupted access to essential primary health services using existing static and mobile health facilities.
The engagement targets life-saving reproductive health (RH) activities including provision of Emergency Obstetrics and Neonatal Care services, quick refresher trainings on major causes of maternal mortality, provision of primary health care services such as vaccinations for at risk groups, referral to and support of secondary health care for severe cases, antenatal care and curative consultants for common endemic diseases. In addition, actions are designed to strengthen disease surveillance and early warning and deployment of rapid response teams to conduct outbreak investigation and response in case of suspected outbreaks.
